description.narrative: Catalyzing Environmental Finance for Low-Carbon Urban Development thereby promoting safer, cleaner, and healthier cities and reducing urban GHG emissions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. Number of new developed partnerships with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions targeting underserved communities/groups and women 2. Amount of project-facilitated investment in low carbon urban development (LCUD) and number of infrastructural LCUD projects implemented 3. tCO2 emissions reductions attributable to the project-facilitated investments in low carbon urban development (LCUD) 4. Number of project beneficiaries including percentage of women 5. Number of people trained on differenet aspects of LCUD considered within the project 6. Status and level of capitalization of the financial mechanism (ESCO funding window) 7. Status of MRV system and MRV for waste sector 8. Number of public facilities and utilities covered by EMIS on municipal level 9. Reduction of fuel consumption form the municipal waste transformation in pilot municipalities 10. Status of relevant LCUD enabling rules and regulations 11. Number of people reached out by national LCUD awareness raising campaign

comment.narrative: 1. Zero (0) partnerships with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions targeting underserved communities/groups and women 2. Zero (0) amount of project-facilitated investment in low carbon urban development (LCUD) and number of infrastructural LCUD projects implemented 3. Zero (0) tCO2 emissions reductions attributable to the investments in low carbon urban development (LCUD) 4. NA 5. Zero (0) people trained on differenc aspects of LCUD considered within the project 6. ESCO funding window does not exist 7. No MRV system in place; No MRV waste sector 8. 2,300 public facilities and utilities covered by EMIS on municipal level 9. NA 10. NA 11. Zero (0) people reached out by national LCUD awareness raising campaign

1. Two new developed partnerships with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions established 2. 500 k USD of investment in LCUD achieved; 2 ESCO LCUD projects initiated 3. tCO2 emissios reductions tracked and reported, attributable to the project-facilitated investments in LCUD 4. Number of project benefifiaries tracked and reported, attributable to the project-facilitated investments in LCUD 5. At least 50 people are trained on LCUD and ESCO 6. ESCO financial mechanisms in FBiH and RS developed and testing phase initiated in 2021 7. IT waste management system in RS developed; trainings on usage of IT system for waste management in FBiH held 8. 200 public facilities and utilities covered by EMIS on municipal level 9. Green logistic schemes for pilot municipalities in FBiH and RS developed and projects proposed 10. Development of enabling rules and regulations; in line with requirements of PB institutions 11. 100,000 (incl. 50,000 of women) reached out by national LCUD awareness raising campaig

1. Nine new developed partnerships with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions established 2. cca 7 mil. USD of investment in LCUD achieved; tender documentation for 5 ESCO LCUD projects (4 public buildings and 1 street lightning system) prepared and announced 3. Tender documentation for 5 ESCO LCUD projects (4 public buildings and 1 street lightning system) prepared and announced. Estimated reduction of CO2 emissions overt the respective lifetime of investments is 9,530.20 tCO2. 4. Tender documentation for 5 ESCO LCUD projects (4 public buildings and 1 street lightning system) prepared and announced. Estimated number of project beneficiaries is 66,991, out of which 33,656 (cca 50%) are women. 5. In 2021, Project has supported development of capacities of 12 LGUs, 6 project board institutions and 50 private sector representatives. Out of 113 trained and educated private and institutional representatives, 55 were female participants. 6. Tender documentation for 5 ESCO LCUD projects (4 public buildings and 1 street lightning system) prepared and announced. Final draft of tender documentation for ESCO piloting on public lightning systems in RS developed and will be announced in 2022. 7. Trainings on usage of IT system for waste management in FBiH held; development of IT waste management system in RS initiated 8. Data on 917 public facilities formally registered as owned or used by municipalities have been covered by EMIS. 9. Green logistic schemes for 8 pilot municipalities in FBiH and RS developed and pilot projects proposed 10. Technical assistance provided for development of 1 strategic document (SECAP for City of Mostar); 3 legislative documents (Law on Climate Change of RS; Draft Law on Air Protection of FBiH and Draft Rulebook on GHG Inventory in FBiH); Analysis of fees for disposal of municipal and industrial non-hazardous waste in FBiH and RS 11. In 2021, Project reached 79,221 people through social media, so far, out of which 58% are women.

1. To establish one partnership with funding for improved energy efficiency and/or sustainable energy solutions targeting underserved communities/groups and women 2. To initiate activities aimed at development of ESCO financial mechanism and SECAPs 3. To initiate activities aimed at development of ESCO financial mechanism and SECAPs 4. Zero project beneficiaries including percentage of women, initiation of activities aimed at development of ESCO. 5. Expansion of EMIS at municipal level in BiH. 6. To initiate activities aimed at development of ESCO financial mechanism and SECAPs 7. To initiate activities aimed at development of IT waste mamangement systems. 8. At least 100 public facilities and utilities covered by EMIS on municipal level 9. To initiate activities aimed at reduction of fuel consumption form the municipal waste transformation in pilot municipalities 10. To provide support atimed at enhancement of LCUD legislative framework in BiH. 11. At least 15,000 people reached out by national awareness raising events and social media channels.

1. Zero (0) partnerships established; international consultant on development of ESCO engaged and inception report prepared; initiated activities on development of SECAPs for selected municipalities; ctivities in RS on establishment of ESCO initiated. 2. Zero investments achieved; initiated activities on development of SECAPs for selected municipalities; activities in RS on establishment of ESCO initiated. 3. Zero tCO2 emissions reductions attributable to the project-facilitated investments in low carbon urban development (LCUD) achieved; activities on estalbishment of ESCO in RS initiated. 4. Zero (0) project beneficiaries including percentage of women reached; activities on estalbishment of ESCO in RS initiated. 5. 90 representatives of public buildings owned by municipalities attended the EMIS trainings. 6. Zero (0) capitalization of the financial mechanism (ESCO funding window); activities on estalbishemnt of ESCO in RS initiated. 7. Service Provider for preparation of IT waste management system in FBiH engaged; ToR for IT waste management system in RS finalized. 8. 150 public facilities and utilities covered by EMIS on municipal level 9. Zero (0) reductions of fuel consumption from the municipal waste transformation in pilot municipalities; public call for selection of municipalities for green logistic schemes development announced. 10. In consultation with Project Board members, ToRs were prepared, local consultants engaged and following documents developed: Draft Law on air protection in FBiH developed and submitted for further adoption; decision on by-law documents to be developed will be made in forthcoming period; Detail analysis of current Law on waste management of RS prepared and amendment of current Law on waste management; Draft Decision on establishment of energy management system at state-level developed; Analysis of all parafiscal charges collected on the basis of environmental pollution in FBiH (Federation, Canton and Local self-government level) is in development and will be finalized in last quarter of 2019. 11. So far, around 20,000 people were reached through social media channels. First awareness raising event was organized in Sarajevo (June 1st, 2019). Approximately 900 people passed by the promo location, near 300 participated in the prize-winning game. 43% of participants were male and 57% female.

USD of parallel-cofinancing by entities environmental funds invested in LCUD projects 3. ESCO RS financial mechanism developed; Rulebook and ESCO contract in FBiH developed 7. IT system for waste management in FBiH developed 8. Data on 490 public facilities have been covered by EMIS on municipal level. 9. 0 reductoin of fuel consumption achieved; waste management plans with green logistic schemes for 4 municipalities in RS under development 10. Draft Law on air protection in FBiH, Draft bylaw document on GHG inventory in FBiH; detailed analysis of the current Law on waste management of RS, Amendment of current Law on waste management in RS, Decision on establishment of energy management system at state-level, Analysis of all parafiscal charges collected on the basis of environmental pollution in FBiH, Draft Rulebook on energy audits for utility services in FBiH, Strategic document in field of energy efficiency at level of BiH, Draft versions of Decree on Environmental Impact Assessment and Decree on Environmental Permitting as bylaw documents of the draft Law on Environmental Protection in the FBiH. 11. 200,000 (100,000 of female citizens) reached through public campaign
